title: Insurance Investment Executive Elected to Church Mutual Board

text:
MERRILL, Wis.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Judith P. (Judy) Greffin, an insurance industry leader and seasoned investment executive, was elected to the board of directors for Church Mutual Insurance Company, effective March 21, 2018.
Greffin spent more than 25 years with Allstate Insurance Company, most recently as Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer, where she led an $85 billion, 300-person investment organization. Prior to joining Allstate, Greffin held senior management roles at Flagship Financial and Huntington National Bank. She also serves on the boards of Associated Banc Corp and Trustmark Companies.
In addition to her corporate responsibilities, Greffin has applied her management and financial acumen to benefit a wide range of professional, civic and non-profit organizations including the Investment Analysts Society of Chicago, Northwestern Memorial Hospital Foundation, The Field Museum of Natural History, the Economic Club of Chicago, DePaul University and Miami University.
She holds an MBA from The Ohio State University and a bachelor’s degree from Miami University. She is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA).
About Church Mutual
Church Mutual Insurance Company, founded in 1897, offers specialized insurance for religious organizations of all denominations, as well as schools, camps, denominational offices and senior living facilities. Church Mutual markets most lines of commercial property and liability insurance, including multi-peril, workers' compensation and commercial auto insurance. In addition to insurance, Church Mutual provides a spectrum of value-added solutions that benefit its customers. Church Mutual holds the following honors:
